title: (x) Hershey's Chocolate logo compact sans - Helvetica Utra Compressed {Yves}
content:
Does anyone know what the typeface is for Hershey’s Chocolate?  
Specifically, the one used on the ribbons found in Hershey’s kisses.

Thanks in advance!!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203314im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/HersheyCo_3883.PNG)

 [‹ The Atlantic's new heavyweight retro sans caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203314/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50323 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Street names on Google Maps - Arial {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203314/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50291 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kintups

comments.content: You mean the compact sans? I think this simply is [Helvetica Ultra Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203314/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_ultra_compressed/). The highlight and shadow line make it difficult to assess the exact weight, but I’m pretty sure.
